thread.title: Govt seeks approval to spend ¢800 million more in 2015
thread.title_full: Govt seeks approval to spend ¢800 million more in 2015

title: Govt seeks approval to spend ¢800 million more in 2015
text:
21 July 2015 15:36 CET Govt seeks approval to spend ¢800 million more in 2015 By Myjoyonline 
Government is asking Parliament to approve for spending this year, an additional 800 million cedis to enable it execute projects outlined in the 2015 budget. 
The request is contained in the Finance Minister’s Supplementary Budget presented to Parliament on Tuesday. 
In addition to this, Mr. Seth Terkper is also presenting to the house the Budget Mid-Year Review. 
The overall GDP growth is expected to be revised from 3.9 percent to 3.5 percent. GDP without oil will also been revised from 2.7 percent to 2.3. 
The overall budget deficit target would revised from 6.5 percent of GDP to 7.3 percent. 
Inflation is expected to be reviewed upward.Looking at figures contained in the supplementary budget, there would be reduction in the expected growth target. 
More soon Other Stories Follow Us It is dangerous for any undisabled independence person to sit down on his bottom and wait for help. By: FRANCIS TAWIAH -->D
